title: Keep Pets Warm Indoors
description: Limit outdoor time and ensure your pets have a warm, cozy spot away from drafts and cold floors.

title: Protect Their Paws
description: Use pet-safe booties or paw balm to protect against snow, salt, and ice that can irritate paw pads.

title: Hydration Is Still Important
description: Even in winter, pets need plenty of water. Make sure their water bowl isn’t frozen or too cold.

title: Avoid Overfeeding
description: Pets may need slightly more calories in cold weather, but don’t overfeed—watch their weight closely.

title: Regular Grooming
description: Keep your pet’s coat clean and mat-free; this helps maintain proper insulation during cold weather.

title: Check for Frostbite
description: Inspect ears, tails, and paws for any signs of frostbite after outdoor activities.
